H0.text: In the culinary world, what word is used for the edible offal of a fowl, typically including the heart, gizzard and liver. Offal

H1.text: In the culinary world, what word is used for the edible offal of a fowl, typically including the heart, gizzard and liver. Innards

H2.text: In the culinary world, what word is used for the edible offal of a fowl, typically including the heart, gizzard and liver. Organ Meat

H3.text: In the culinary world, what word is used for the edible offal of a fowl, typically including the heart, gizzard and liver. Giblet

A4.text: Giblets is a culinary term for the edible offal of a fowl, typically including the heart, gizzard, liver, and other organs.

A5.text: The neck is often included with the giblets; in the West it is usually separated from the body during butchering.
